item.title: 比特币暴跌致温克莱沃斯兄弟超级政治行动委员会捐款缩水数百万
item.description: 由加密货币亿万富翁兄弟卡梅伦·温克莱沃斯和泰勒·温克莱沃斯创立的政治筹款组织在2025年最后五个月筹集了超过2200万美元，但其比特币投入可能无法获得同等回报。【原文：The political fundraising group launched by crypto-billionaire brothers Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss raised more than $22 million in the last five months of 2025, but might not get as much bang for its Bitcoin.】

item.title: 亚马逊在西雅图裁员1400人，当地科技岗位持续萎缩
item.description: 亚马逊公司本周宣布裁员1.6万人，其中西雅图地区约1400人，邻近的贝尔维尤市约700人，相关文件已提交至州及地方当局。【原文：Amazon.com Inc.’s 16,000 job cuts announced this week include about 1,400 in Seattle and approximately 700 in the neighboring suburb of Bellevue, according to documents filed with state and local authorities.】

item.title: 美联储的米兰认为沃什是富有说服力且备受尊敬的新任主席
item.description: 美联储理事斯蒂芬·米兰表示，他预计特朗普总统提名的美联储主席人选凯文·沃什将在领导美联储货币政策委员会方面表现出色。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Stephen Miran said he expects Kevin Warsh, President Donald Trump’s pick to lead the central bank, will prove effective in his leadership of the Fed’s monetary policy committee.】

item.title: 在美国总统特朗普的支持下，美国即将进口一年来最多的委内瑞拉石油
item.description: 在特朗普政府采取措施控制委内瑞拉能源供应后，美国即将创下一年来最大规模的委内瑞拉原油进口纪录。【原文：The US is set to import the most Venezuelan oil in a year after President Donald Trump’s administration moved to control the country’s energy supply.】

item.title: 牛肉价格与新计算方法令阿根廷通胀前景蒙上阴影
item.description: 阿根廷央行在月度货币政策报告中指出，在总统哈维尔·米莱将通胀率从三位数水平大幅压低后，该国未来数月进一步抑制通胀的努力将面临风险。【原文：Argentina’s push to further curb inflation faces risks in coming months after President Javier Milei hammered it down from triple-digit territory, the central bank said in its monthly monetary policy report.】

item.title: 法国健康初创企业Alan正以50亿欧元估值进行融资谈判
item.description: 知情人士透露，法国健康保险初创企业Alan正寻求以50亿欧元（约合59亿美元）的估值进行融资，以扩大其客户群。【原文：Alan is in talks to raise funds at a €5 billion ($5.9 billion) valuation as the French health-insurance startup works to expand its customer base, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 庞巴迪集会因特朗普威胁加拿大喷气机面临新障碍
item.description: 私人飞机制造商庞巴迪公司股价的强劲涨势周五遭遇阻碍，因美国总统特朗普威胁对加拿大飞机征收50%关税，并取消所有在加拿大制造的新飞机的认证。【原文：Private jet-maker Bombardier Inc.’s bullish run hit a roadblock Friday as President Donald Trump threatened to slap a 50% tariff on aircraft from Canada and decertify all new planes made there.】

item.title: 摩根大通开始出售200亿美元EA收购债务的一部分
item.description: 摩根大通公司等多家银行已开始减持备受瞩目的200亿美元债务融资，该融资用于支持对艺电公司的收购——这是有史以来规模最大的杠杆收购案。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. is among banks that have begun selling down a highly anticipated $20 billion debt financing backing the acquisition of Electronic Arts Inc., the biggest leveraged buyout on record.】

item.title: 阿波罗为零售客户带来18%回报，其私募股权投资风险更高
item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司去年为个人投资者创造了18.3%的回报率，其策略主要押注于私募股权公司希望长期持有或无法出售的单一企业——部分投资者认为这种策略风险相对较高。【原文：Apollo Global Management Inc. reaped returns of 18.3% last year for individual investors by largely betting on single companies that private equity firms want to hold longer or can’t sell — a strategy viewed by some investors as being relatively risky.】

item.title: 蒂利斯在联邦争端中坚持禁止投票立场，但赞扬沃什
item.description: 共和党参议员汤姆·蒂利斯重申，在针对美联储翻修工程的刑事调查终止前，他将阻挠凯文·沃什出任美联储主席一事，尽管他认为该提名本身是合适的。【原文：Republican Senator Thom Tillis reiterated his intention to block Kevin Warsh from becoming chairman of the Federal Reserve until a criminal investigation into renovations at the Fed is stopped, despite his belief that the nomination is a good one.】

item.title: 新指控笼罩帝亚吉欧与朝日的东非交易
item.description: 一名肯尼亚承包商对帝亚吉欧公司提起新诉讼，要求法院在另一项诉讼解决前，禁止该公司向朝日集团控股公司出售其在东非的资产。【原文：A Kenyan contractor filed a fresh case against Diageo Plc, asking a court to block its proposed sale of East African assets to Asahi Group Holdings Plc until a separate matter is resolved.】

item.title: 法国兴业银行计划推出由高盛管理的美国股票基金
item.description: 据知情人士透露，法国兴业银行旗下资产管理公司正与高盛集团商讨设立一只专注于美国股票的投资基金。【原文：Societe Generale SA’s asset management unit is in discussions with Goldman Sachs about setting up an investment fund focused on US equities, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 在微软股价暴跌期间抄底的基金跑赢99%同类基金
item.description: 过去三年中，有99%的同类基金都跑不赢它——这家法国基金周四趁微软股价暴跌3570亿美元之际大举买入，预测其在人工智能领域的重金投入终将获得回报。【原文：A French fund that has beaten 99% of its peers over the past three years bought into Microsoft Corp.’s $357 billion rout on Thursday, predicting its heavy investments in artificial intelligence will eventually pay off.】

item.title: 南非股市创四月以来最大跌幅，金属股重挫
item.description: 南非股市4月创下最大跌幅，矿业股在贵金属领域惊人的抛售潮中遭受重创。【原文：South African stocks plunged the most in April as mining shares were swept up in the stunning selloff across precious metals.】

item.title: 明尼苏达州女子称因与边检人员冲突遭全球入境计划取消资格
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯零售巨头塔吉特公司的一位支付总监表示，她在机场安检的快速通道通行权被撤销，起因是她与一名联邦边境巡逻人员发生交涉。该巡逻人员声称自己配备了面部识别系统，并正通过"随身摄像头"进行录像。【原文：A payments director at the Minneapolis-based retail giant Target Corp. said her fast-track credentials for airport security were revoked following an interaction with a federal border patrol agent who claimed he had facial recognition and was recording with a “body cam.”】

item.title: Germany to Push for End of Gas Storage Targets After 2027 Expiry
item.description: German officials are preparing to push for the European Union to discontinue its gas storage targets when they expire in 2027, and instead implement an alternative strategic reserve system that would be managed by individual member states.

item.title: Sandisk’s 1,700% Rally Keeps Going After ‘Unprecedented’ Quarter
item.description: Digital storage company Sandisk Corp.’s strong revenue and earnings outlook is extending a blistering rally in the top performing stock in the S&P 500 Index.

item.title: NJ to NYC Trains Delayed by 45 Minutes Due to Blocked Tunnel
item.description: A brutal week for commuters continued Friday with New Jersey Transit rail service in and out of New York’s Penn Station subject to large delays.

item.title: US Stocks Slide After Trump’s Fed Chair Pick, Hotter PPI Data
item.description: US equities continued their slide Friday morning as traders bet that President Donald Trump’s pick to replace Jerome Powell as chair of the Federal Reserve would bring a hawkish stance to the central bank.

item.title: Trafigura Was Victim of Nickel Fraud on Grand Scale, Judge Says
item.description: 伦敦法官裁定，富商普拉蒂克·古普塔实施的镍金属欺诈案"规模巨大"，特拉菲古拉集团是该案受害者，这为这家贸易公司追回其6亿美元损失中的一部分提供了机会。【原文：Trafigura Group was the victim of a nickel fraud “on a grand scale” perpetrated by tycoon Prateek Gupta, a London judge ruled, giving the trading house a chance to recoup some of the $600 million in losses it suffered.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉重启美元拍卖 效果乏力难提振玻利瓦尔
item.description: 分析师指出，委内瑞拉重启美元销售的规模可能过于有限且难以预测，难以稳定玻利瓦尔汇率，这使得美元黑市持续承压。【原文：Venezuela’s resumption of dollar sales is probably too limited and too unpredictable to stabilize the bolivar, keeping the parallel market for dollars under pressure, analysts say.】

item.title: 法国股市LVMH的困境拖累了奢侈品行业业绩发布前市场表现
item.description: 在去年短暂喘息之后，路威酩轩集团再度成为法国股市的难题。【原文：LVMH has resurfaced as a problem for French stocks after a brief respite last year.】

item.title: Banks Ready $7.9 Billion Debt Sale to Finance Sealed Air Buyout
item.description: Banks are preparing to sell about $7.9 billion in debt as early as February to finance Clayton Dubilier & Rice’s buyout of packaging firm Sealed Air Corp.

item.title: Fed’s Bostic Says Elevated Inflation Should Keep Rates on Hold
item.description: Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Raphael Bostic said elevated inflation means the US central bank should wait before it cuts interest rates again.

item.title: Instacart to Help Costco Take Grocery Orders in Europe in International Push
item.description: Costco Wholesale Corp. will use Instacart's technology to power online grocery ordering in Spain and France, extending their partnership beyond North America for the first time as the delivery company looks overseas for growth.

item.title: India Regulator Clears NSE IPO Plan Ending Decade-Long Wait
item.description: National Stock Exchange of India Ltd. has received clearance from the securities market regulator to initiate steps for an initial public offering, the bourse said in a statement.

item.title: US Producer Prices Top Forecasts on Higher Services Costs
item.description: US wholesale prices rose by more than forecast in December, suggesting companies are increasingly passing on tariff costs at the risk of keeping inflationary pressures elevated.

item.title: Oil’s Year of The Glut Begins With an Unexpected Price Surge
item.description: It was supposed to be the year of glutted oil markets and lower prices, but the first weeks of 2026 have instead been dominated by geopolitical spikes and supply disruption, powering futures to $70 a barrel.

item.title: Canada Economy on Track to Shrink 0.5% in Fourth Quarter
item.description: Canada’s gross domestic product likely shrank in the fourth quarter, highlighting choppy performance as the trade-dependent economy adjusts to US tariffs.

item.title: 德国通胀率在2026年首次欧洲央行会议前小幅突破2%
item.description: 在欧洲最大经济体去年年底录得意外强劲增长后，德国通胀率略有加速。【原文：German inflation accelerated slightly after Europe’s largest economy recorded surprisingly strong expansion at the end of last year.】
